relation: Bike thefts are a major issue on campus. There is campus police that patrols the area at random times. There are many cars that do not have the semester parking pass. They take up space for those who really need the parking. It is an issue that needs more attention. There are days where one can go without displaying the parking permit and one will not receive a ticket. In other words, there needs to be more patrolling and ticket-serving as there are those who really need parking.
Although there is a school cafe, the menu list is relatively small. Waiting times and organization can get really out of hand during the first few weeks of instruction.

Depending on your major and daily schedule, class difficulty and rigor will be dependent. However, for the most part and from word of mouth, most class exams will consist of multiple choice, true and false, and short answer. Keep in mind, however, that it will depend on many factors such as what you define as rigorous and your academic level.

Study and really put the effort into your courses. It is school, after all. If necessary, have a weekly schedule to manage your time wisely and have an agenda to keep track of deadlines and important dates. Look into Transfer Day during the month of September. Use Assist.ORG and Ratemyprofessor.com to make the best out of your semester. Accept every chance that is offered for PRIORITY registration. You will have the best selection of classes and schedules. Classes fill up fast so this is your chance. If you really want to save money on books, use CRAIGSLIST.ORG and search in the Books category. Most of the time, you find the book(s) for your class. No waiting needed and you can resell them instead of just returning them when you rent them. So use Craigslist, Craigslist, Craigslist!

For a 100-year old community college, it is a very forestry and beautiful school. The student environment is friendly, one feels welcomed, and staff is friendly. The location is convenient and near major avenues and a highway.
pageTitle: Fresno City College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {324219=Love going to the movies when I can, enjoy trying new restaurants and small dining places to our Fresno area with friends and or family. And I try to get out to the local events. April is packed: being treated to Wicked for my birthday at the Saroyan Theater, last weekend Clovis hosted Big Hat Days, and soon we have Vintage Days at Fresno State, and the Clovis Rodeo at the end of the month. But lately with my higher pace with school, sometimes I just like to enjoy relaxing with my dogs and enjoying some reruns of Bones or Castle., 339956=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 249998=October fest, people come to school in costumes... it's a little strange., 154156=Avoid the parking for the first three weeks of school and park in neighborhood street before 7:20. textAfterTable: 06/15/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 out of 3 people found this review useful. 2 of 78 Categories Comments Campus Safety There is a strong presence of the district police. The Campus is well lit and there is a plentiful amount of people on campus even when dark. Greek Life There are no Greek Frats or Sor. at City College Clubs and Activities Fresno City College has a long list of clubs, you will most definitively find one that suits you. You can find a list of these clubs on the Fresno city college website. Great for these types of students Students wanting to attend a four year university but not wanting to tackle all those expenses for the four/five years they attend that university. Also great for those wishing to attend a UC with guarantee transfer admission. Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus By the Student Lounge you will find an Arcade with pool tables and arcade games
